     10 runfiles_tmpl = '''#!/bin/bash -eu
     11 # If a binary is listed as a data dep for another tool, you
     12 # need to scan a bit differently for the runfiles dir. Of course, once
     13 # this is resolved by realpath, the path will never have .runfiles in
     14 # it when developing because of the way the files are symlinked, hence
     15 # splitting the abspath.
     16 #
     17 # This also allows symlinks to bazel built binaries in production to correctly
     18 # find their runfiles. This is commonly used in production to put bazel
     19 # binaries in the PATH.
     20 #
     21 # Note: We call python by passing the script through stdin instead of using -c
     22 #       to prevent Python from prepending '' to sys.path and allowing
     23 #       modules from $PWD to be imported as top level modules.
     24 
     25 STUBPATH=$(/usr/bin/env python -ESs <(echo "import os.path; print(os.path.realpath(os.path.abspath('$0').split('.runfiles')[0]));"))
     26 STUBPATH=$STUBPATH.runfiles
     27 
     28 export RUNFILES=$STUBPATH/{workspace_name}
     29 
     30 {content}
     31 '''
     32 
     33 def _get_runfiles_tmpl(ctx, content):
     34     # If we're building an external binary, then we need to use the
     35     # workspace name of that binary, not the current workspace.
     36     if ctx.label.workspace_root:
     37         if not ctx.label.workspace_root.startswith("external/"):
     38             fail("Workspace root must start with external/: {}".format(
     39                 ctx.label.workspace_root,
     40             ))
     41         workspace_name = ctx.label.workspace_root[len("external/"):]
     42     else:
     43         workspace_name = ctx.workspace_name
     44 
     45     return runfiles_tmpl.format(
     46         content = content,
     47         workspace_name = workspace_name,
     48     )
     49 
     50 def _get_package_dir(ctx):
     51     return ctx.label.package
     52 
     53 def _get_output_dir(ctx):
     54     # If it's an external label, output to workspace_root.
     55     if ctx.label.workspace_root:
     56         return ctx.configuration.bin_dir.path + "/" + ctx.label.workspace_root + "/" + _get_package_dir(ctx)
     57 
     58     return ctx.configuration.bin_dir.path + "/" + _get_package_dir(ctx)
     59 
     60 def _get_relpath(ctx, src):
     61     package_prefix = _get_package_dir(ctx) + "/"
     62 
     63     relpath = src.short_path
     64 
     65     # If relpath starts with '../', that means it belongs to an
     66     # external dependency, and it'll look like:
     67     #   '../{workspace_name}/{package_path}/{file}
     68     # We want to transform it so it includes the package path
     69     # and the file.
     70     if relpath.startswith("../"):
     71         parts = relpath.split("/")
     72         relpath = "/".join(parts[2:])
     73 
     74     if not relpath.startswith(package_prefix):
     75         fail("Path must be in the package: (path: {relpath}, package prefix: {package_prefix})".format(
     76             relpath = relpath,
     77             package_prefix = package_prefix,
     78         ))
     79 
     80     return relpath[len(package_prefix):]

     82 def _new_node_modules_srcs_dict():
     83     """Returns a new `node_modules_srcs_dict` dict. It's just a normal
     84     dict, this function exists so we can document how it works in one
     85     place.
     86 
     87     `node_modules_srcs_dict` is a map from paths relative to the
     88     highest-level node_modules directory to Files.
     89 
     90     E.g. if you have a file that's going to end up in:
     91         main-module/node_modules/some-dep/dep.js
     92 
     93     The key should be `some-dep/dep.js`.
     94 
     95     NOTE: Make sure to fail if you need to add a path to
     96     `node_modules_srcs_dict` that already exists.
     97 
     98     """
     99     return {}
    100 
    101 def _new_all_node_modules():
    102     """Returns a new `all_node_modules` dict. It's just a normal
    103     dict, this function exists so we can document how it works in one
    104     place.
    105 
    106     `all_node_modules` is a map from unique targets to
    107     `node_modules_srcs_dict`s.
    108 
    109     The key should be unique to the package, and doesn't necessarily
    110     have any other semantic meaning.
    111     """
    112     return {}

    114 def _npm_library_impl(ctx):
    115     node_module_srcs = []
    116 
    117     npm_req = ctx.attr.npm_req
    118     if "@" not in npm_req:
    119         fail("npm_req must contain a '@': {npm_req}".format(npm_req = npm_req))
    120 
    121     # The module name is everything before the last '@'.
    122     require_name = npm_req.rsplit("@", 1)[0]
    123     require_prefix = require_name + "/"
    124 
    125     node_modules_srcs_dict = _new_node_modules_srcs_dict()
    126     for content in ctx.attr.contents:
    127         if content in node_modules_srcs_dict:
    128             fail("Duplicate path in node_modules: {content}".format(content = content))
    129 
    130         if not content.startswith(require_prefix) and not content.startswith(".bin/"):
    131             fail(("npm library cannot include paths outside of {require_name} " +
    132                   "or '.bin': {content}").format(require_name = require_name, content = content))
    133 
    134         # The created files are all under `node_modules/` because
    135         # that's where the npm installer puts them.
    136         node_modules_srcs_dict[content] = ctx.actions.declare_file("node_modules/" + content)
    137 
    138     shrinkwrap = ctx.file.shrinkwrap
    139 
    140     command_args = [
    141         shrinkwrap.path,
    142         _get_output_dir(ctx),
    143     ]
    144     if ctx.attr.npm_installer_extra_args:
    145         command_args.extend(ctx.attr.npm_installer_extra_args)
    146 
    147     env = {}
    148     if "HTTP_PROXY" in ctx.var:
    149         env["HTTP_PROXY"] = ctx.var["HTTP_PROXY"]
    150     if "HTTPS_PROXY" in ctx.var:
    151         env["HTTPS_PROXY"] = ctx.var["HTTPS_PROXY"]
    152 
    153     ctx.actions.run(
    154         inputs = [shrinkwrap],
    155         outputs = node_modules_srcs_dict.values(),
    156         executable = ctx.executable.npm_installer,
    157         arguments = command_args,
    158         progress_message = "installing node modules from {}".format(shrinkwrap.path),
    159         mnemonic = "InstallNPMModules",
    160         env = env,
    161     )
    162 
    163     all_node_modules = _new_all_node_modules()
    164     all_node_modules[str(ctx.label)] = node_modules_srcs_dict
    165 
    166     return struct(
    167         all_node_modules = all_node_modules,
    168     )
    169 
    170 _npm_library_internal = rule(
    171     attrs = {
    172         "shrinkwrap": attr.label(
    173             allow_single_file = True,
    174             mandatory = True,
    175         ),
    176         "npm_req": attr.string(mandatory = True),
    177         "contents": attr.string_list(mandatory = True),
    178         "npm_installer": attr.label(
    179             executable = True,
    180             cfg = "host",
    181         ),
    182         "npm_installer_extra_args": attr.string_list(),
    183     },
    184     implementation = _npm_library_impl,
    185 )

    187 def npm_library(
    188         name,
    189         npm_req,
    190         shrinkwrap,
    191         contents,
    192         no_import_main_test = False,
    193         npm_installer = "@org_dropbox_rules_node//node/tools/npm:install",
    194         npm_installer_extra_args = []):
    195     """Defines an external npm module.
    196 
    197     This rule should usually be generated using
    198     `//node/tools/npm:gen_build_npm`, like this:
    199 
    200       bazel run @org_dropbox_rules_node//node/tools/npm:gen_build_npm -- my-module@1.2.3 ~/src/myrepo/npm/my-module
    201 
    202     Defines an external npm module. The module and its dependencies
    203     are downloaded using `npm_installer`.
    204 
    205     All of the module's dependencies are declared in the shrinkwrap but
    206     aren't known by Bazel. This is to work around Bazel's restrictions on
    207     circular dependencies.
    208 
    209     One restriction that this rule places on it's output is that all
    210     the files output must either be in the module's directory or in
    211     '.bin'. E.g. if the module is named `module-name`, then this list
    212     of contents is legal:
    213 
    214         contents = [
    215             'module-name/src/something.js',
    216             '.bin/some-binary',
    217         ]
    218 
    219     But this list of contents is not:
    220 
    221         contents = [
    222             'module-name/src/something.js',
    223             'another-modules/something-else.js',
    224         ]
    225 
    226     This allows us to be reasonably sure that any two modules can be
    227     used together (except when '.bin' has conflicts, which should be
    228     rare).
    229 
    230     Args:
    231       npm_req: The npm string used to download this module. Must be in the form `module-name@1.2.3`.
    232         Used to auto-generate this rule.
    233 
    234       no_import_main_test: Don't test that the npm library can be required as if it has a main file. Defaults to False.
    235 
    236         We test that all imports can be imported like: `require('module')`. For some imports that don't
    237         have a `main` js file to execute, this import will fail. For example, `@types/` npm modules will
    238         fail. Set this to True to disable that check.
    239 
    240         NOTE: This rule will still generate a test to make sure that module version is correct.
    241 
    242       shrinkwrap: The shrinkwrap file that lists out all the node modules to install.
    243 
    244       contents: All of the files needed by the module.
    245 
    246         contents is a string list instead of a label list to get around Bazel's restrictions on
    247         label names, which are violated by npm packages pretty often. Some restrictions still exist,
    248         like the restriction that file names cannot contain whitespace.
    249 
    250       npm_installer: The binary to use to install the npm modules.
    251 
    252         The default npm_installer downloads them from the public npm registry, but ideally you
    253         should replace it with a binary that downloads from your private mirror.
    254 
    255       npm_installer_args: Extra arguments to pass to `npm_installer`.
    256 
    257     """
    258     _npm_library_internal(
    259         name = name,
    260         contents = contents,
    261         npm_installer = npm_installer,
    262         npm_installer_extra_args = npm_installer_extra_args,
    263         npm_req = npm_req,
    264         shrinkwrap = shrinkwrap,
    265     )
    266     _node_import_test(
    267         name = name + "_import_test",
    268         no_import_main_test = no_import_main_test,
    269         npm_req = npm_req,
    270         deps = [name],
    271     )
    272 
    273 def _collect_srcs_and_deps(ctx):
    274     """
    275     Collects all the srcs and deps from ctx's direct and transitive dependencies.
    276 
    277     Returns the tuple (srcs, all_node_modules).
    278     """
    279     srcs = depset(ctx.files.srcs)
    280     all_node_modules = _new_all_node_modules()
    281 
    282     # Verify that `srcs` are not node_library or npm_library rules.
    283     for src in ctx.attr.srcs:
    284         if hasattr(src, "all_node_modules"):
    285             fail("Invalid src, srcs must only be files: {}".format(src.label))
    286 
    287     for dep in ctx.attr.deps:
    288         if hasattr(dep, "srcs"):
    289             srcs += dep.srcs
    290 
    291         if hasattr(dep, "all_node_modules"):
    292             for key, value in dep.all_node_modules.items():
    293                 if key not in all_node_modules:
    294                     all_node_modules[key] = value
    295 
    296     return (srcs, all_node_modules)
    297 
    298 def _node_library_impl(ctx):
    299     srcs, all_node_modules = _collect_srcs_and_deps(ctx)
    300 
    301     return struct(
    302         srcs = srcs,
    303         all_node_modules = all_node_modules,
    304         runfiles = ctx.runfiles(collect_default = True),
    305     )
    306 
    307 node_library = rule(
    308     attrs = {
    309         "srcs": attr.label_list(allow_files = True),
    310         "deps": attr.label_list(allow_files = False),
    311         "data": attr.label_list(allow_files = True),
    312     },
    313     implementation = _node_library_impl,

    316 """
    317 Groups node.js sources and deps together.
    318 
    319 Args:
    320   srcs: The list of source files that are processed to create the target.
    321   deps: The list of other libraries or node modules needed to be linked into
    322     the target library.
    323   data: The list of files needed by this library at runtime.
    324 """
    325 
    326 def _construct_runfiles(ctx, srcs, all_node_modules):
    327     """
    328     Create the set of runfiles for node rules.
    329 
    330     Puts all of the node modules in `$RUNFILES/{pkg_dir}/node_modules`
    331     for the binary target.
    332 
    333     Fails if any files in all_node_modules conflict with each other.
    334     """
    335     package_dir = _get_package_dir(ctx)
    336     if ctx.label.workspace_root:
    337         if not ctx.label.workspace_root.startswith("external/"):
    338             fail("Workspace root must start with external/: {}".format(
    339                 ctx.label.workspace_root,
    340             ))
    341         package_dir = ctx.label.workspace_root[len("external/"):] + "/" + package_dir
    342 
    343     symlinks = {}
    344     for node_modules_srcs_dict in all_node_modules.values():
    345         for content_path, src in node_modules_srcs_dict.items():
    346             path = package_dir + "/node_modules/" + content_path
    347 
    348             if path in symlinks:
    349                 fail(("Cannot have conflicting paths in node_modules. This path was " +
    350                       "in your node modules twice: {path}. These are the deps included " +
    351                       "in your node_modules folder: {all_node_modules_keys}").format(
    352                     path = path,
    353                     all_node_modules_keys = all_node_modules.keys(),
    354                 ))
    355 
    356             symlinks[path] = src
    357 
    358     # If the binary is in an external workspace, then we should create
    359     # symlinks relative to the runfiles root.
    360     if ctx.label.workspace_root:
    361         return ctx.runfiles(
    362             files = list(srcs),
    363             root_symlinks = symlinks,
    364             collect_default = True,
    365         )
    366     else:
    367         return ctx.runfiles(
    368             files = list(srcs),
    369             symlinks = symlinks,
    370             collect_default = True,
    371         )
    372 
    373 def _node_binary_impl(ctx):
    374     srcs, all_node_modules = _collect_srcs_and_deps(ctx)
    375 
    376     # Add node binary to runfiles
    377     srcs = srcs.to_list()
    378     srcs += [ctx.file.node]
    379 
    380     node_flags = ["--preserve-symlinks"]
    381     if ctx.attr.max_old_memory:
    382         node_flags.append("--max_old_space_size={}".format(ctx.attr.max_old_memory))
    383     if ctx.attr.expose_gc:
    384         node_flags.append("--expose-gc")
    385 
    386     default_args = " ".join(ctx.attr.extra_args + ['"$@"'])
    387 
    388     # We use --preserve-symlinks so that node will respect the symlink
    389     # tree in runfiles. One quirk of preserve symlinks is that
    390     # symlinks aren't preserved for the "main" module. To work around
    391     # this, we create an wrapper js file that just has a call to
    392     # `require('/path/to/main.js')`.
    393     #
    394     # We can't do `node --eval "require('/path/to/main.js')"` because
    395     # node won't populate process.argv correctly.
    396 
    397     # Create the inner wrapper with the require call.
    398     inner_wrapper = ctx.actions.declare_file(ctx.outputs.executable.basename + "-wrapper.js", sibling = ctx.outputs.executable)
    399     srcs += [inner_wrapper]
    400     ctx.actions.write(
    401         inner_wrapper,
    402         """require(process.env['BAZEL_NODE_MAIN_ID']);""",
    403     )
    404 
    405     # Some scripts use the pattern `if (require.main === module) {` to
    406     # only execute something if the node script is the "main" script.
    407     # If you want that to work with bazel, you should check
    408     # BAZEL_NODE_MAIN_ID against the module id instead, like this:
    409     #   if (process.env['BAZEL_NODE_MAIN_ID'] === module.id || require.main === module) {
    410     node_runfile_tmpl = """
    411 export BAZEL_NODE_MAIN_ID=$RUNFILES/{main}
    412 export NODE_PATH=$RUNFILES/{node_path}
    413 
    414 $RUNFILES/{node} {node_flags} $RUNFILES/{inner_wrapper} {default_args}
    415 """
    416     runfile_content = _get_runfiles_tmpl(
    417         content = node_runfile_tmpl.format(
    418             main = ctx.file.main.short_path,
    419             node = ctx.file.node.short_path,
    420             node_flags = " ".join(node_flags),
    421             inner_wrapper = inner_wrapper.short_path,
    422             default_args = default_args,
    423             node_path = _get_package_dir(ctx) + "/node_modules",
    424         ),
    425         ctx = ctx,
    426     )
    427 
    428     # Generate output executable
    429     ctx.actions.write(
    430         output = ctx.outputs.executable,
    431         content = runfile_content,
    432         is_executable = True,
    433     )
    434 
    435     runfiles = _construct_runfiles(ctx, srcs, all_node_modules)
    436     return struct(runfiles = runfiles)
    437 
    438 _node_bin_attrs = {
    439     "srcs": attr.label_list(allow_files = True),
    440     "deps": attr.label_list(allow_files = False),
    441     "data": attr.label_list(allow_files = True),
    442     "main": attr.label(
    443         allow_single_file = True,
    444         mandatory = True,
    445     ),
    446     "extra_args": attr.string_list(),
    447     "node": attr.label(
    448         allow_single_file = True,
    449         default = Label("@nodejs//:node"),
    450     ),
    451     "max_old_memory": attr.int(),
    452     "expose_gc": attr.bool(default = False),

    455 node_binary = rule(
    456     attrs = _node_bin_attrs,
    457     executable = True,
    458     implementation = _node_binary_impl,
    459 )
    460 
    461 """Creates a node binary, which is an executable Node program consisting
    462 of a collection of `.js` source files.
    463 
    464 Node binaries are created using `--preserve-symlinks`.
    465 
    466 One quirk of this rule is that if your script uses the pattern:
    467 
    468 ```javascript
    469   if (require.main === module) {
    470 ```
    471 
    472 to only execute something if the node script is the "main" script,
    473 you'll need to modify it to check `BAZEL_NODE_MAIN_ID` against the
    474 module id instead, like this:
    475 
    476 ```javascript
    477   if (process.env['BAZEL_NODE_MAIN_ID'] === module.id || require.main === module) {
    478 ```
    479 
    480 All node modules that this rule depends on, direct and transitive, end
    481 up flattened in `{package-directory}/node_modules`, where
    482 `package-directory` is the directory that the node_binary target
    483 is it. This means that, across all of your transitive dependencies
    484 tracked by Bazel, you can't depend on different versions of the same
    485 node module. (This does not apply to transitive dependencies of
    486 npm_library rules, which are not tracked by Bazel.)
    487 
    488 The environmental variable `NODE_PATH` is set to
    489 `{package-directory}/node_modules` so that all the files that end up
    490 running can find all the included node modules.
    491 
    492 One side-effect of that is that node libraries have access to all the
    493 transitive dependencies for the node binary that depends on them.
    494 
    495 Examples:
    496     ```python
    497     node_binary(
    498         name = 'mybin',
    499         srcs = [
    500             'mybin.js',
    501         ],
    502         expose_gc = True,
    503         main = 'mybin.js',
    504         deps = [
    505             '//npm/loose-envify',
    506             '//npm/minimist',
    507             '//npm/mkdirp',
    508         ],
    509     )```
    510 
    511     ```python
    512     node_library(
    513         name = 'lib',
    514         srcs = ['lib.js'],
    515         deps = [
    516             '//npm/mkdirp',
    517         ],
    518     )
    519 
    520     node_binary(
    521         name = 'bin',
    522         srcs = ['bin.js'],
    523         deps = [
    524             ':lib',
    525         ],
    526     )
    527     ```
    528 
    529 Args:
    530   srcs: The list of source files that are processed to create the target.
    531   deps: The list of other libraries included in the binary target.
    532   data: The list of files needed by this binary at runtime.
    533   main: The name of the source file that is the main entry point of the
    534     application.
    535   extra_args: Command line arguments that bazel will pass to the target when it
    536     is executed either by the `run` command or as a test. These arguments
    537     are passed before the ones that are specified on the `bazel run` or
    538     `bazel test` command line.
    539   node: The node binary used to run the binary. Must be greater than 6.2.0.
    540   max_old_memory: Optional. Node, by default, doesn't run its garbage collector on old space
    541     until a maximum old space size limit is reached. This overrides the default (of around 1.4gb)
    542     with the provided value in MB.
    543   expose_gc: Optional. Expose `global.gc()` in the node process to allow manual requests for
    544     garbage collection.
    545 
    546 """
    547

    554 """
    555 Defines a basic node test. Succeeds if the program has a return code of
    556 0, otherwise it fails.
    557 
    558 Args:
    559   srcs: The list of source files that are processed to create the target.
    560   deps: The list of other libraries included in the binary target.
    561   data: The list of files needed by this binary at runtime.
    562   main: The name of the source file that is the main entry point of the
    563     application.
    564   extra_args: Command line arguments that bazel will pass to the target when it
    565     is executed either by the `run` command or as a test. These arguments
    566     are passed before the ones that are specified on the `bazel run` or
    567     `bazel test` command line.
    568   node: The node binary used to run the binary. Must be greater than 6.2.0.
    569 """

    571 def mocha_test(
    572         name,
    573         srcs = [],
    574         deps = [],
    575         extra_args = [],
    576         mocha_target = "@org_dropbox_rules_node//npm/mocha",
    577         chai_target = "@org_dropbox_rules_node//npm/chai",
    578         **kwargs):
    579     """
    580     Defines a node test that uses mocha. Takes the same args as
    581     `node_binary`, except that you can't pass a `main` arg,
    582     because mocha is run as the main js file.
    583 
    584     Args:
    585       srcs: The list of files to test.
    586       deps: The list of other libraries included in the binary target.
    587       extra_args: The list of other args for this test.
    588       mocha_target: The target to use for including 'mocha'.
    589       chai_target: The target ot use for including 'chai'.
    590     """
    591 
    592     if "main" in kwargs:
    593         fail("You cannot provide a 'main' to node_test rules. Use 'srcs' instead.")
    594     if not srcs:
    595         fail("'srcs' cannot be empty")
    596 
    597     root = "$RUNFILES/" + native.package_name()
    598 
    599     mocha_args = [root + "/" + src for src in srcs]
    600 
    601     additional_deps = [mocha_target, chai_target]
    602 
    603     # bin/mocha is the outer wrapper, and it calls `_mocha` as a
    604     # new process, which messes up the `require` logic somehow.
    605     #
    606     # TODO: After node is upgraded to 7.1.0+, set the env
    607     # NODE_PRESERVE_SYMLINKS=1 and see if `bin/mocha` works.
    608     main = "node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha"
    609 
    610     node_test(
    611         name = name,
    612         srcs = srcs,
    613         main = main,
    614         deps = depset(additional_deps) + deps,
    615         extra_args = extra_args + mocha_args,
    616         **kwargs
    617     )
    618 
    619 def _node_internal_module_impl(ctx):
    620     if ctx.attr.package_json and ctx.attr.main:
    621         fail("Can only specify one of package_json or main")
    622 
    623     srcs, all_node_modules = _collect_srcs_and_deps(ctx)
    624 
    625     require_name = None
    626     if ctx.attr.require_name:
    627         require_name = ctx.attr.require_name
    628     else:
    629         require_name = ctx.label.name
    630 
    631     if ctx.attr.package_json:
    632         srcs = depset([ctx.file.package_json], transitive = srcs)
    633     elif ctx.attr.main:
    634         # Create a package.json file that points to the 'main' js
    635         # file.
    636         package_json_src = ctx.actions.declare_file("package.json")
    637         main = ctx.file.main
    638 
    639         main_relpath = _get_relpath(ctx, main)
    640         ctx.actions.write(
    641             package_json_src,
    642             '''{{"main": "{main_relpath}"}}'''.format(main_relpath = main_relpath),
    643         )
    644         srcs = depset([package_json_src], transitive = [srcs])
    645 
    646     node_modules_srcs_dict = _new_node_modules_srcs_dict()
    647     for src in srcs.to_list():
    648         relpath = _get_relpath(ctx, src)
    649 
    650         require_path = require_name + "/" + relpath
    651         if require_path in node_modules_srcs_dict:
    652             fail("Duplicate path in node_modules: {require_path}".format(
    653                 require_path = require_path,
    654             ))
    655         node_modules_srcs_dict[require_path] = src
    656 
    657     all_node_modules[str(ctx.label)] = node_modules_srcs_dict
    658 
    659     return struct(
    660         all_node_modules = all_node_modules,
    661         runfiles = ctx.runfiles(collect_default = True),
    662     )
    663 
    664 node_internal_module = rule(
    665     attrs = {
    666         "srcs": attr.label_list(allow_files = True),
    667         "deps": attr.label_list(allow_files = False),
    668         "data": attr.label_list(allow_files = True),
    669         "require_name": attr.string(),
    670         "package_json": attr.label(allow_single_file = True),
    671         "main": attr.label(allow_single_file = True),
    672     },
    673     implementation = _node_internal_module_impl,
    674 )
    675 
    676 """
    677 Create an internal node module that can be included in the `deps` for
    678 other rules and that can be required as `require('module_name')`.
    679 
    680 Args:
    681   srcs: The list of source files that are processed to create the target.
    682   deps: The list of other libraries included in the target.
    683   data: The list of files needed by this target at runtime.
    684 
    685   require_name: Optional. The name for the internal node module. E.g.
    686     if `require_name = "my-module"`, it should be used like
    687     `require('my-module')`. The default is the target name.
    688 
    689   package_json: Optional. The package.json for the project. Cannot be
    690     specified along with `main`.
    691 
    692   main: Optional. Defaults to the `main` field in the package.json or
    693     `index.js` if that doesn't exist. Cannot be specified along with
    694     `package_json`.
    695 
    696 """
    697 
    698 def _node_import_test(name, deps, npm_req, no_import_main_test):
    699     """
    700     Test that the module `npm_req` can be imported and that its
    701     version is correct.
    702 
    703     Args:
    704       deps: The list of other libraries included in the target.
    705       npm_req: Must be in the form `module-name@1.2.3`.
    706       no_import_main_test: Don't test that the npm library can be required as if it has a main file.
    707         See npm_library for details.
    708 
    709     """
    710 
    711     # Break npm_req into its name and version.
    712     if "@" not in npm_req:
    713         fail("npm_req is malformed, it must look like `module-name@1.2.3`: " + npm_req)
    714     split = npm_req.split("@")
    715 
    716     import_name = "@".join(split[:-1])
    717     import_version = split[-1]
    718 
    719     args = [
    720         "--import_name=" + import_name,
    721         "--import_version=" + import_version,
    722     ]
    723     if no_import_main_test:
    724         args.append("--no_import_main_test")
    725 
    726     node_test(
    727         name = name,
    728         size = "small",
    729         srcs = ["@org_dropbox_rules_node//node/tools:import_check.js"],
    730         extra_args = args,
    731         main = "@org_dropbox_rules_node//node/tools:import_check.js",
    732         deps = deps,
    733     )
    734 
    735 def _node_build_impl(ctx):
    736     env = dict(ctx.attr.env.items() + {
    737         "BAZEL_OUTPUT_DIR": _get_output_dir(ctx),
    738     }.items())
    739 
    740     args = []
    741     if ctx.var["COMPILATION_MODE"] == "opt" and ctx.attr.optimize_flag:
    742         args.append(ctx.attr.optimize_flag)
    743 
    744     ctx.actions.run(
    745         executable = ctx.executable.builder,
    746         outputs = ctx.outputs.outs,
    747         env = env,
    748         arguments = args + ctx.attr.extra_args,
    749         mnemonic = "NodeBuild",
    750         progress_message = "building {} with node".format(ctx.label.name),
    751     )
    752     return struct(
    753         files = depset(ctx.outputs.outs),
    754         runfiles = ctx.runfiles(
    755             files = ctx.outputs.outs,
    756             collect_default = True,
    757         ),
    758     )
    759 
    760 node_build = rule(
    761     attrs = {
    762         "outs": attr.output_list(mandatory = True),
    763         "data": attr.label_list(allow_files = True),
    764         "builder": attr.label(
    765             executable = True,
    766             cfg = "host",
    767             mandatory = True,
    768         ),
    769         "env": attr.string_dict(),
    770         "extra_args": attr.string_list(),
    771         "optimize_flag": attr.string(),
    772     },
    773     implementation = _node_build_impl,
    774 )
    775 
    776 """Build JS/CSS/etc with a node binary.
    777 
    778 This is a low-level rule, and is only recommended for completely
    779 custom node builds. If you're using webpack, you should use the
    780 webpack_build rule. If you're using another standard JS build system
    781 (rollup, gulp, grunt, ...), you should write a macro that follows the
    782 conventions of webpack_build.
    783 
    784 This rule does not have a `srcs` attribute because it expects all the
    785 srcs needed for the build to be included in the `builder` binary.
    786 
    787 The environmental variable `BAZEL_OUTPUT_DIR` is set for all builds.
    788 The `builder` binary should output to that directory.
    789 
    790 For more specific use cases, you should write a macro that creates
    791 this rule (see webpack_build).
    792 
    793 Args:
    794   outs: The list of files output by this rule.
    795   data: The list of files needed by this target at runtime.
    796   builder: The node binary used to build.
    797   env: Additional environmental variables to set for the build.
    798   extra_args: The list of additional args for this build.
    799   optimize_flag: The flag to pass to the build when it's run in "opt" mode.
    800     If this flag is not defined, then no flag is passed in "opt" mode.
    801 
    802 """
    803 
    804 def webpack_build(
    805         name,
    806         srcs = [],
    807         deps = [],
    808         data = [],
    809         config = "",
    810         outs = [],
    811         env = {},
    812         extra_args = [],
    813         webpack_target = "@org_dropbox_rules_node//npm/webpack"):
    814     """
    815     Build JS/CSS/etc with webpack.
    816 
    817     It's recommend that you use the internal node module `dbx-bazel-utils`
    818     (`@org_dropbox_rules_node//node/dbx-bazel-utils`). If you use it like
    819     this:
    820 
    821     ```javascript
    822     var dbxBazelUtils = require('dbx-bazel-utils');
    823     var env = dbxBazelUtils.initBazelEnv(__dirname);
    824     ```
    825 
    826     Then it will set the working directory to the directory that contains
    827     webpack.config.js, which is usually what you want, and you should
    828     output to the directory in `env.outputRoot`.
    829 
    830     If the webpack build is run outside of Bazel, then `env.outputRoot`
    831     will be `__dirname`.
    832 
    833     Defaults to using webpack@3.4.1. You can specify your own webpack
    834     target with `webpack_target`.
    835 
    836     Examples:
    837       ```python
    838       # webpack_build/BUILD
    839       load('@org_dropbox_rules_node//node:defs.bzl', 'webpack_build')
    840 
    841       webpack_build(
    842           name = 'webpack_build',
    843           srcs = glob([
    844               'src/*.js',
    845           ]),
    846           outs = ['bundle.js'],
    847           config = 'webpack.config.js',
    848           deps = [
    849               '@org_dropbox_rules_node//node/dbx-bazel-utils',
    850           ],
    851       )
    852       ```
    853 
    854       ```javascript
    855       // webpack_build/webpack.config.js
    856       var path = require('path');
    857       var dbxBazelUtils = require('dbx-bazel-utils');
    858       var env = dbxBazelUtils.initBazelEnv(__dirname);
    859 
    860       module.exports = {
    861         entry: ['entry.ts'],
    862         output: {
    863           filename: 'bundle.js',
    864           path: env.outputRoot,
    865         },
    866       }
    867       ```
    868 
    869     Args:
    870       srcs: The list of source files that are processed to create the target.
    871       deps: The list of other libraries included in the target.
    872       data: The list of files needed by this target at runtime.
    873       outs: The list of files output by this rule.
    874       extra_args: The list of additional args for this build.
    875       env: Additional environmental variables to set for the build.
    876       config: The webpack.config.js file.
    877       webpack_target: The webpack target to use.
    878 
    879     """
    880     if not config:
    881         fail("Must specify a config")
    882     if not outs:
    883         fail("Must specify output")
    884 
    885     srcs += [config]
    886 
    887     deps += [webpack_target]
    888 
    889     node_binary(
    890         name = name + "_bin",
    891         srcs = srcs,
    892         data = data,
    893         extra_args = [
    894             "--config",
    895             "$RUNFILES/{pkg}/{config}".format(
    896                 pkg = native.package_name(),
    897                 config = config,
    898             ),
    899         ] + extra_args,
    900         main = "node_modules/webpack/bin/webpack.js",
    901         deps = deps,
    902     )
    903     node_build(
    904         name = name,
    905         outs = outs,
    906         builder = name + "_bin",
    907         data = data,
    908         env = env,
    909         optimize_flag = "-p",
    910     )
    911 
    912 NODEJS_BUILD_FILE_CONTENT = r"""
    913 package(default_visibility = [ "//visibility:public" ])
    914 
    915 filegroup(
    916     name = "node",
    917     srcs = [ "bin/node" ],
    918 )
    919 
    920 filegroup(
    921     name = "npm",
    922     srcs = glob([
    923         "bin/npm",
    924         "bin/node",
    925         "lib/node_modules/npm/**/*",
    926     ]),
    927 )
    928 """
    929 
    930 def _nodejs_dist_impl(repository_ctx):
    931     version = repository_ctx.attr.version
    932     if repository_ctx.os.name == "mac os x":
    933         sha256 = repository_ctx.attr.sha256["darwin"]
    934         platform = "darwin-x64"
    935     else:
    936         sha256 = repository_ctx.attr.sha256["linux"]
    937         platform = "linux-x64"
    938 
    939     url = "https://nodejs.org/dist/v%s/node-v%s-%s.tar.xz" % (version, version, platform)
    940     strip_prefix = "node-v%s-%s" % (version, platform)
    941 
    942     repository_ctx.download_and_extract(
    943         url = url,
    944         stripPrefix = strip_prefix,
    945         sha256 = sha256,
    946     )
    947     repository_ctx.file("BUILD", content = NODEJS_BUILD_FILE_CONTENT)
    948 
    949 _nodejs_dist = repository_rule(
    950     _nodejs_dist_impl,
    951     attrs = {
    952         "version": attr.string(default = "6.11.1"),
    953         "sha256": attr.string_dict(
    954             default = {
    955                 "linux": "e68cc956f0ca5c54e7f3016d639baf987f6f9de688bb7b31339ab7561af88f41",
    956                 "darwin": "60521df5c436552bc09ae68e8399e7e32cf34c36b21f1dd93c4ddfa421ed7ef0",
    957             },
    958         ),
    959     }
    960 )
